headline: Tesla stops taking orders in China for US-made cars
summary: The ongoing trade battle between the US and China has led the automaker to stop taking orders in China for vehicles that are made in the United States. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Pras Subramanian reports on that story and the new, cheaper Cybertruck trim. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: BYD Stock Soars. Trade Wars Can Hae Unintended Consequences.
summary: The stock rose 7.2% in overseas trading.  Stock indexes were volatile after China announced 125% tariff rates on U.S. imports.  Tesla is no longer taking orders for its Model S, X, or Cybertruck in China, according to its website.

headline: Tesla Stock Is Down 28%. Time to Buy the Dip?
summary: Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) has been one of 2025's worst-performing megacap stocks, with shares down by a whopping 28% year to date, compared to the S&P 500's decline of 7% over the same period.  The electric automaker is facing a combination of rising competition and political pressure that is calling its persistently high valuation into question.  Let's dig deeper to see if this sell-off is a buying opportunity or a signal of more trouble ahead.

headline: China-Europe Détente Could Hurt Tesla, Help BYD
summary: As tariffs spiral between the U.S. and China, between China and Europe they are showing early signs of falling, potentially helping BYD and hurting Tesla.  The European Commission in Brussels, which handles trade on behalf of the European Union, confirmed Friday it is in talks with Beijing about an alternative to its current tariffs on Chinese EVs.  In a conversation Tuesday, EU trade commissioner, Maroš Šefčovič, and Chinese Commerce Minister Wang Wentao discussed the idea of price undertakings, whereby manufacturers agree to minimum prices, a spokesman said.

raw.headline: China-Europe Détente Could Hurt Tesla, Help BYD
raw.summary: As tariffs spiral between the U.S. and China, between China and Europe they are showing early signs of falling, potentially helping BYD and hurting Tesla.  The European Commission in Brussels, which handles trade on behalf of the European Union, confirmed Friday it is in talks with Beijing about an alternative to its current tariffs on Chinese EVs.  In a conversation Tuesday, EU trade commissioner, Maroš Šefčovič, and Chinese Commerce Minister Wang Wentao discussed the idea of price undertakings, whereby manufacturers agree to minimum prices, a spokesman said.

headline: Tesla, Apple, Jamie Dimon comments: Trending Tickers
summary: Brad Smith and Madison Mills take a closer look at some of Yahoo Finance's trending tickers. Tesla (TSLA) has stopped taking orders in China for two car models that are imported from the US amid the ongoing US–China trade war. Apple (AAPL) is in focus after Wedbush analysts said the iPhone maker is the tech company most negatively impacted by President Trump's tariffs. JPMorgan Chase (JPM) CEO Jamie Dimon says the US economy faces "considerable turbulence." To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Lucid Stock Jumped This Week, but Here's Why It Might Not Last
summary: As of early Friday morning, the Nasdaq Composite index was 5.4% higher for the week mainly thanks to Wednesday's historic rally.  Shares of EV maker Lucid Group (NASDAQ: LCID) were doing even better, surging by 10.5%, according to data provided by S&P Global Market Intelligence.  Interest may have increased thanks to consumers' displeasure with Tesla CEO Elon Musk and his political activity.
